channel.title: Iso allstar base help
channel.description: If there are any members who are familiar with the AllStarScape(317) base, greatly appreciate it if you could direct me to the server ip's in order to change them. I can't find them for the life of me, every key word i type either isn't there or there's thousands of them. I usually don't have this problem :/ Thanks in advanced.

item.title: Iso allstar base help
item.dc:creator: @testcrasher1 testcrasher1
item.description:
@testcrasher1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:532405”][quote author=testcrasher1 link=topic=651197.msg4368618#msg4368618 date=1380158627]

Remember:
127.0.0.1 is for localhost, meaning the computer that is running the source.
192.168.XXX.XXX is for LAN (Local Area Network) Meaning all computers connected to the same internet access point
http://whatismyip.com < Your IP you want to use if you want OTHER people on OTHER networks to connect.

As an IT major i’d really hope i know that by now thanks for the help anyway! I have actually narrowed it down to a port forwarding problem at this point. The strange thing is that i’ve port forwarded with this router before and had no issues so i’m assuming it has something to do with some system configurations, i’ll try to keep you guys updated.
[/quote]
I wouldn’t know your background. When I try and attempt to help, I have to assume you know little to none (unless proven otherwise earlier).[/quote]

Oh no hard feelings at all man, i just kind of laughed to myself a little bit. Not trying to act egotistical or anything, sorry if i came across that way.

Close This Please

Read full topic
